question: Hi guys. Did you have any luck with those concert tickets Stanley?
answer: I sure did. Friday night, just like you wanted.

question: Oh, Stanley, that's wonderful.
answer: What time should I pick you up?

question: Gee, I don't know. My best girlfriend just got into town and I know she'd love to go. Can we get an extra ticket for her?
answer: Well... uh, actually it's sold out. I was kinda lucky to get these.

question: She's only going to be in town a couple of days and I just can't let her sit at home all alone. Are you sure there isn't something we can do?
answer: You know what? Here. You two go.

question: Oh Stanley, I couldn't do that.
answer: No really. Go ahead. It's okay. I hate concerts anyway. All that, you know... music floating around.

question: That is so sweet. Sheila's just going to love this.
answer: So maybe you and I can get together over the weekend?

question: I'm not sure what's going on, but just give me a call. You know I like to be spontaneous.
answer: Oh, sure. Me too.

question: That's it.
answer: What?

question: The kiss of death. As soon as they use the "N" word it's all over.
answer: So maybe I am a nice guy. So what?

question: You are a rug. I am talking astro-turf here. You're letting these women sharpen their cleats on you.
answer: Hey, I'm a gentleman. If they can't appreciate that, it's their problem.

question: You spend too much time being "nice" to a girl, you'll wind up sittin' around listening to her complain about the son of a bitch she really loves.
answer: Charlie, you are a very sick puppy.

question: Wake up, Stanley! These are the nineties. We're dealing with an entire generation of dysfunctional love junkies. You can't romance 'em. You gotta confuse 'em. It's the only thing that gets their attention. Hi Lisa.
answer: Oh, hi...

question: Charlie.
answer: That's right. Sorry.

question: Lisa, this may seem a little odd, but my friend over there and I were having this discusion and I thought maybe you could settle it for us.
answer: I'll help out if I can. That's okay. Go ahead.

question: Alright. Just for the sake of argument, if I wasn't a happily married man... am I the kind of guy you'd go out with?
answer: Oh, um... I don't know.

question: Lisa, I have terrific news for you.
answer: What?

question: I'm not married! Is this perfect or what? Listen, there's not a lot of women willing to come right out like that and admit they're attracted to a guy, but... Jeez... make up your mind. Okay. Bad example. Some of these women got so much baggage they need an emotional sky cap. I'll tell you what Stanley, tonight I'm gonna take you on a love safari, deep into the darkest heart of the urban jungle.
answer: And where's that?

question: The Monkey's Paw. Hottest new club in town. It's a guaranteed skirt alert and no dead beats allowed.
answer: So how are we gonna get in?

question: Woah, do I detect a little self-image problem there, buddy? You just leave everything to me. This, my friend is going to be the perfect night on the town. Hold the phone. Killer at three o'clock. Oh my god... A perfect dime. The dame of dames. The Moby of my dick.
answer: Easy Charlie. You'll sprain your eyes.

question: Excuse me, where can I open a new account?
answer: You've come to the right place, ma'am. Just step right this way and pull up a chair...

question: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm a complete wreck. Will you hold this please?
answer: Here, let me take that for you.

question: Thanks.
answer: So, uh, what kind of account did you have in mind?

question: Well, I'm not sure exactly. I'm just terrible with things like that. That's an interesting tie Mr...?
answer: Ipkiss. Stanley Ipkiss...

question: Tina Carlyle. Pleased to meet you.
answer: The, uh... pleasure's all mine.

question: May I? I'm such a mess.
answer: Oh... of course.

question: As I was saying about that tie. It's like one of those, what do you call them, ink blot tests.
answer: A Rorschach test.

question: That's it. It looks like... um. A young woman riding bareback. You know, like a Lady Godiva or something.
answer: Really? I don't think I can...

question: Or... if that's not a horse it could be two lovers. A man and a woman. That would be the woman on top, of course. What do you see, Mr. Ipkiss?
answer: I don't know. ...Bold colors. It's a power tie, y'know? They're supposed to make you feel... powerful.

question: Does it work?
answer: Sort of. It's just a tie. Now, about that account.

question: That's it sweetheart. A little to the right. Hey, will you guys keep it down back there?
answer: That's cool, man. Freeze it right there.

question: What do you think, Doctor?
answer: Layout's not bad. We got us a sweet little Perkins/Jenning time lock. But them motion detectors are putting the chill on my thrill.

question: Can you pull it off?
answer: Hey, you're talkin' with the Doctah, man. It's all about time and money.

question: Yeah, well the meter's runnin' on this one. We got less than a week.
answer: Not cool. What about the coin?

question: There's plenty. And I'll be happy to invest your share.
answer: What you talkin' about, man?

question: This isn't about the lousy couple hundred thou' that's sitting in that vault, Freeze. That's chump change.
answer: Yeah? Then I'm chump number one, man.

question: We gotta expand your horizons Doctor. Take a look. The Valhalla Casino. Twenty mil of glass, neon, booze and dice. World class sucker bait. The grand opening is Saturday night and it will drive this two bit club of mine out of existence. But I say if you can't beat 'em, take 'em over.
answer: Yeah? That's Arnie the Swede's place, man and he is one ice cold meatball eatin' motha fucker.

question: Hold it up right here, please.
answer: No! No! He only wants you to stop the cab! It's alright, Stanley. Why are you getting out here?

question: I gotta pick up my car.
answer: Fine. Now don't forget. Ten o'clock at the Monkey's Paw. I've already got us lined up with a couple of authentic dimes.

question: Charlie, please. The last time you said that you showed up with two lesbian mud-wrestlers.
answer: Well, I can't promise we'll get that lucky again... Later!

question: Ohh... I dunno. About seven hundred bucks. Now what can I do for you, Bub?
answer: I'm here for the Civic.

question: Japanese car, right? Kind of a nasty pea soup green?
answer: Well, they call it Emeral Forest, actually...

question: But I just brought it in for an oil change!
answer: Yeah? Well you're lucky we caught those other problems before they caused some serious trouble.

question: Alright. Alright. When will it be ready?
answer: Come back tomorro... ...First thing next wee... ...next month? Yeah, first thing next month. That's if we can get the parts.

question: What am I going to do in the meantime? I can't afford to keep taking cabs all over town.
answer: Oh, hell... we can take care of that! Hey Burt, bring around the loaner. And for you little buddy, only ten bucks a day.

question: It's a classic.
answer: Hey, Stanley. Nice wheels. What is that, a Rolls Canardley?

question: A what?
answer: You know, a Rolls Canardley. Rolls down one hill canardley roll up the next.

question: We are not discussing the car, okay?
answer: Whatever you say, man. What do you think? Pretty terrific, huh? This place make Sodom and Gomorrah look like Mayberry.

question: Hey, isn't that...
answer: Right. The wet dream from the bank.

question: Doesn't it bother you that all the women you know are named after cartoon characters?
answer: No, problemo. Ladies, this is my pal Stanley Ipkiss. Stanley's very influential in the banking business. Hey Bobby! Bobby, buddy. What's happening man? This will just take a second. Yo Nick! It's me... Charlie!

question: Forget it, Charlie. I refuse to stand here waiting to be judged by these power-mad steroid jockeys.
answer: How much cash you got on you?

question: What?
answer: You heard me. How much you got?

question: I dunno, fifty or sixty bucks.
answer: Hand it over.

question: No way.
answer: Hey, I'll pay you back! I'm only carrying plastic. C'mon man, you want to stand out here all night? Hey Bobby!

question: Thanks Reno, you're the greatest.
answer: That was a great performance, baby. But not as great as the one you pulled off at the bank.

question: Yeah, well don't get used to it. I'm not going to start running cons for you again, Dorian. I'm a singer now and that's it.
answer: Oh, really? And you had such a red hot career before you latched on to me?

question: Who latched on to who?
answer: Get real, Tina. You'll do what I say or I'll drop you back where I found you, slingin' hash and dodgin' horny peterbuilt drivers.

question: Don't push me, Nicky. I might just take a walk I should have taken a long time ago.
answer: C'mere. You take a hike and who's gonna kiss you like Dorian Tyrel. C'mon. Who?

question: Nobody.
answer: That's right, baby. C'mere.

question: Sorry. I never get personal in front of the help.
answer: That broad kills me.

question: Thanks Officer. Uh... no. They just gave me a lift. Alright, you guys. It's been a tough night. I haven't got any money. I haven't got a car. All I have is this and you're welcome to it. Uh... yeah.
answer: Ipkiss! Do you have any idea what time it is?

question: Actually, no.
answer: It's three o'clock in the morning! First, you wake up the entire building laughing it up with your pals. Then, you come in and start squeak - My new carpet! Just look at that! This is coming out of your cleaning deposit Ipkiss! ...Yes.

question: Now these are serious chili dogs.
answer: I know. Here's the proof... Aaah. Even tastier the second time around.

question: Hey Burt, pull on my finger.
answer: No way, man.

question: No, really. Go ahead.
answer: Irv, don't...

question: Okay, how about... Soprano.
answer: Fine muscle control.

question: A dream... It was only a dream.
answer: Nice PJ's pal.

question: Can I help you?
answer: You're Ipkiss? Stanley Ipkiss?

question: That's right.
answer: Some kind of prowler broke in and attacked Mrs. Peenman.

question: Really? I didn't hear a thing.
answer: Then you must be a pretty sound sleeper, Ipkiss 'cause she unloaded a couple rounds of 20 ott buckshot five feet from your door. Excuse me?

question: What happened to you last night? The girls and I were looking all over for you.
answer: I uh, didn't feel so good. I decided to go home early.

question: As a matter of fact, you don't look so good. You got to take better care of yourself, man.
answer: How was the club?

question: Are you kidding? It was hotter than a pistol. Did you see the paper?
answer: No.

question: Your girlfriend got a great review.
answer: Sorry, Mr. Dicky. It won't happen again.

question: Ah... She's a prospective client of Stanley's, sir.
answer: Yes sir, Mr. Dickey.

question: Look at that little creep. If it wasn't for his daddy he'd be out somewhere shakin' down school kids for lunch money.
answer: You think she ever will come back, Charlie?

question: Who knows? Forget about her, Stanley. A dame like that is always looking for the B.B.D. The bigger better deal. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar.
answer: You don't know that. She's an artist. Maybe she's sensitive.

question: Stanley Ipkiss? Hi. I'm Peggy Brandt. I'm with the Evening Star.
answer: Oh, hi. I already have a subscription, thanks.

question: Oh no, actually I just wanted to ask you a few questions.
answer: Really? About what?

question: Ripley Auto Finishing. You're a customer of theirs aren't you?
answer: I... uh. No. I think you must have made a mistake.

question: Isn't this a form of theirs you filled out?
answer: Oh, that Ripley Auto. I guess I have stopped in there once or twice, Miss... what did you say your name was?

question: Peggy Brandt.
answer: Wait a minute... Peggy Brandt of "Ask Peggy"?

question: That's right.
answer: You printed my letter last year, remember? "Nice Guys Finish Last."

question: You're Mr. Nice Guy? Stanley do you realize how much mail we got about that letter? There's hundreds of women out there who are looking for a man just like you.
answer: Are you serious?

question: Of course. DO you know how hard it is to find a decent man in this town? Most of them think monogamy is some kind of wood.
answer: Why are you covering this story?

question: They cut my salary. I just can't make it by on "Dear Peggy" anymore. The truth is, I want to be a real reporter and if I can break this story I know they'll let me. Look Stanley, I know Ripley Auto is a crooked operation. They may even have had ties to the Mob. I'm not out to get you. I just want the truth.
answer: I wish I knew the truth, Peggy. I really do.

question: I am now. C'mere, baby. Tina? Milo, down. Stupid, stupid. She'd never...
answer: Through his bedroom window, propped up on the fourth story ledge. Its leering grin seems to beckon Stanley as we begin to hear the POUNDING beat of the Mask F.X. theme.

question: stands transfixed, staring at the moonlit face. He can almost hear echos of faint whispered VOICES calling his name. A deadly siren song above the pounding drums. takes a last look at the crumpled picture of Tina in his hand and finally loses control. He bolts from the room.
answer: Stanley... Stanley.

question: What the hell happened to you?
answer: I'll be okay. Nobody puts the chill on Freeze.

question: Where's the money?
answer: Deal went south, Bro'. Someone else hit the place before we did.

question: Who?
answer: Don't know. Dude looked like a freakin' goblin or something. Next thing we know there's cops all over us, man.

question: Where's Chun Woo?
answer: Takin' a dirt nap. It was bad, man. Real bad. I need a smoke.

question: Clear the club. Now! stands at the edge of the dance floor, his smoking gun trained on the Mask.
answer: Gee willickers! Does this mean we won't make the Star Search finals?

question: This means you won't make it out of this club alive if you don't tell me where my money is.
answer: Okay... You got a 27.5% in T-Bills amortized over the fiscal yeah 16-3/4% in stocks and bonds/ Carry the nine and divide by the Gross National Product...

question: Drop it, Tyrel!
answer: Hello, Kellaway. You got a warrant or did you just drop by for a night cap?

question: I got probable cause. A couple of your boys were spotted knocking over Edge City Bank.
answer: Easy, junior. You're givin' me a woodey. For once you're on the right track, but that's not one of my men. Maybe you ought to try a little actual police work instead of this harassment bullshit.

question: This isn't harassment. You want to see some harassment? Search the place, boys.
answer: Ever wonder why you didn't make Captain, asshole? I got friends so high up they'd give you a nose bleed.

question: Police. Open up.
answer: Oh my god!

question: Ipkiss! I know you're in there.
answer: All right, I'm coming! Lieutenant, what a surprise! What can I do for you?

question: You can answer a few questions.
answer: I've got to get ready for work.

question: Trust me. Your bank's opening late today. Where were you last night?
answer: Here... mostly. Is something wrong?

question: Maybe, yes. Maybe, no. Maybe it's all just a crazy coincidence that this so called "Mask" character always seems to be wherever you are.
answer: Mask -- who?

question: Don't insult my intelligence, Ipkiss. First, he's spotted in your building, then the bank where you work and now I find this at the Monkey's Paw.
answer: Milo. No! Okay, so I went out on the town last night. A guy's got to have a little fun.

question: In your jammies?
answer: Naw, I just took 'em with me in case I didn't make it home. I don't know about you, Lieutenant. But I've got a pretty good track record with the ladies.

question: Wait a second... you smell that?
answer: What? What are we gonna do, Milo? What are we gonna do?

question: A fifty thousand dollar reward to the man who finds this "Mask" character before the cops do. Get the word out to every street hustler and low life in this town. I want him here. In my office. Alive. By tomorrow! Now get going! What are you looking at?
answer: You. You're losing it Dorian.

question: I'm losing nothing. Except maybe some extra baggage I don't need around here.
answer: What's that supposed to mean?

question: You weren't putting up much of a fight when that green goon kissed you last night.
answer: C'mon, did it look to you like I had a choice?

question: Excuse me a second. Tina... What are you doing here?
answer: I heard about the robbery. I guess I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

question: Oh, don't worry about me.
answer: Are you sure? You look a little...

question: I'm just having a little trouble sleeping is all.
answer: I'm not so sure I'll have much to open an account with anymore.

question: What about the nightclub? I thought you were doing great.
answer: I don't know how much longer I can stay there Stanley. Things are getting a little intense.

question: Well, there must be plenty of other places you could sing. Maybe even get a record deal...
answer: I wish it was that easy. There's thousands of girls out there just like me who...

question: Not just like you. You've got a voice like... like an angel.
answer: An angel huh? That's the first time I've heard that one.

question: No, I mean it. You really do.
answer: I can vamp my way through a tune. But that's not really singing.

question: What is it with you, Tina? Why don't you believe in yourself? So maybe you've been singing for the wrong guys.
answer: I'm not so sure there's any other kind. Not for me, anyway.

question: Yeah.
answer: What about this guy, the Mask? Do the cops have a line on him?

question: I'm not sure. Why are you interested?
answer: Promise you won't say anything?

question: Sure.
answer: He came to the club last night and he was just so... well, different. I haven't been able to get him off my mind.

question: Really? They say he's pretty weird looking.
answer: Yeah. He's ugly... but he's kinda cool... y'know, like Mick Jagger.

question: You really think so?
answer: Yeah. If you hear anything about him, would you call me at the club?

question: Actually... I sort of know the guy.
answer: What?

question: The Mask. We're - old college buddies him and I.
answer: Are you serious?

question: Oh yeah. To tell you the truth, I'm sorta covering for him on this bank thing. He's not such a bad guy, really. He just gets a little carried away.
answer: I'll say. Do you think you could give him a message?

question: I suppose so.
answer: Tell him I want to see him again

question: When? I mean, I'd need to tell him exactly.
answer: How about seven o'clock tonight at Peninsula Park.

question: Dorian... thanks for coming by, kid.
answer: My pleasure, Swede. It's been too long. I was worried you were still pissed about that little thing with Harry the Hat.

question: That? It was nothing. He was a pain in my ass anyway. Here, sit down, sit down.
answer: Congratulations on the new casino.

question: Thanks, but it might be a little early to celebrate. As a matter of fact that's why I asked you to stop by.
answer: Is that right?

question: Here... have a little something to eat. That's Svenska meatballs, kid. The real thing.
answer: Thanks.

question: So, I tell you Dorian, it's a terrible shame. I put all my hard work into this beautiful casino and what do you think? All the sudden I got all kinda problems with the city. Big problems. The whole deal could fold.
answer: Maybe I can help you out. I'm expecting to come into a little investment capital shortly. If worse comes to worse and you really need to bail out...

question: What a sweet guy. Isn't this guy a sweetheart? Thanks for the offer Dorian, but I think maybe I can solve this myself.
answer: Is that right?

question: That's right. You know that Councilman you got in your pocket? Well now you've got 'im in your mouth. How you like that? Now listen close scumbag! You want to bw in business with me? Okay, we're partners now. I'm takin' fifty per cent off the Monkey's Paw. You screw with me again and I'll send you straight down to Hell with your scumbag councilman. You can apologize for eatin' him for lunch.
answer: Sure, Swede. Take it easy.

question: Very interesting... looks like tenth or eleventh century Scandinavian. Where did you get this?
answer: I found it... or it found me. I'm not sure. The problem is it's ruining my life!

question: So you believe this actually changes you into a different person?
answer: Yes! It's turning me into some kind of lunatic!

question: Mr. Ipkiss, please. This is just obsessional dellusion. What you have here is nothing more than a piece of wood.
answer: But your book says masks...

question: My book uses masks as a metaphor for our complex personalities. The masks we must present to the outside world... to suppress the id. To protect our innermost desires.
answer: Yeah, well this one works in reverse.

question: You're going to have to be willing to work on this delusion or...
answer: It's not a delusion! Alright, I'll prove it to you if I have to, but I won't be responsible for the consequences.

question: Mr. Ipkiss please! There is no such thing as a magical mask.
answer: Last chance to hide all dangerous objects.

question: Alright then, go on. You're not going to frighten me.
answer: Whooooooooaaaaa...

question: Whoa, what?
answer: It didn't work?

question: Does that surprise you? The mask is nothing but a reflection of you - the inner you.
answer: It worked last night. And the night before. Maybe it only works at night... What kind of mask did you say this was.

question: Scandinavian. It looks like a representation of Loki, the Norse God of Mischief. He supposedly caused so much trouble that Odin banished him from Valhalla forever.
answer: But what should I do about my date?

question: Your date?
answer: You know. Tonight. The park. Tina. Do I go as myself of the Mask?

question: Stanley, what are you doing here?
answer: Oh, Tina... Hi. You're early.

question: A little.
answer: I just... wanted to make sure you two got together okay.

question: That's nice. You know, I hardly ever stop by here. It's hard to believe it was just a garbage heap.
answer: It's always beautiful at sunset. Those methane emissions really pick up the colors.

question: Wow. They really do. All those pinks and greens.
answer: Well... I'm sure my cousin will be along any minute. He never shows up anywhere 'till after sundown. He's sort of strange that way.

question: No, Stanley. Stay for a second. I was thinking about what you said and I, uh, I want you to know I appreciate it. Maybe you're right. If I believed in myself a little more I wouldn't rely on guys like Dorian.
answer: Dorian... You mean Dorian Tyrel?

question: Yeah. He's sort of my manager.
answer: Tina, you've got to be careful of that guy. He's a dangerous criminal.

question: You really mean that, don't you?
answer: Absolutely. You ought to hear the stories...

question: No, I mean, you're really worried about me. That's... real sweet, Stanley.
answer: C'mon, Tina this is serious. How involved are you with this guy?

question: I can take care of myself, Stanley. I always have.
answer: Oh, really? People close to Tyrel have a nasty habit of turning up dead, or haven't you noticed?

question: Look, this may sound a little cold but I do what I have to do to get by, okay? I'm nobody in this town without Dorian.
answer: And who are you with him Tina? I'm not exactly sure who I am anymore but at least I'm trying to find out. If you really had any faith in yourself, you wouldn't be hanging on to some kind of free ride.

question: Our love is like a red red rose, and I'm feeling so thorny already, I'd like to nip you in the bud! Cigarette? Regular? Menthol? Filter? Cigar? Cigarette? Tiparillo? Let me get that for you! Aaaaaah. And now... amore!
answer: Freeze! Put your hands up!

question: But eu 'tol me 'oo freeze!
answer: Alright, alright. Unfreeze! You're under arrest!

question: Under arrest! My god! The Law! I knew I'd forgotten something! What... What'll they do with me, Sarge?
answer: Sorry, son. That's not my department. Search him!

question: Sorry, son. That's not my department. Search him!
answer: Comb - Flintstones vitamins - Sousaphone - Bazooka -

question: What the --? You son of a bitch -- ! Get him!
answer: Hey, he's not bad.

question: Stanley! Get in!
answer: Thanks. Where are we going?

question: Someplace where we'll be safe. I saw it. I saw the whole thing. What's happening to you, Stanley?
answer: It's crazy... I've lost all control. When I put on this mask I can do anything... be anything, but it's ruining my life.

question: Stanley, I don't know what's happening to you, but I do know this. That letter you sent my column was from a guy with more guts and heart than any of the creeps I've met in Edge City. Whatever this mask is, you don't need it. You... Stanley Ipkiss, are already all you ever need to be.
answer: Gosh, Peggy. Do you really mean that? What?

question: I still can't believe it. Hardened cops dancin' in the streets... and broadcast all over the ten o'clock news.
answer: The SWAT team got an offer to open for Wayne Newton.

question: I'm history. The Captain's going to have my badge for breakfast. With a little pension on top.
answer: C'mon Lieutenant, it wasn't your fault. Something will turn up.

question: You've got to listen to me! Go find yourself a new home, Milo. It looks like I'm going to be here for a long long time... About time you found me a lawyer... ...Tina?
answer: Hello, Stanley.

question: What's wrong? Your boyfriend kick you out for not delivering me on schedule?
answer: Is that what you think - that I set you up?

question: I don't know. But I've got plenty of time to figure it out.
answer: You're just going to have to trust me on this.

question: Now is not the best time for me on trusting women.
answer: I ran out on Dorian last night, Stanley. I just came to tell you I'm sorry. Sorry about everything.

question: You ran out on him?
answer: That magic mask of yours turned him into some kind of monster...

question: He wasn't exactly Mother Theresa in the first place.
answer: He's going to the casino opening tonight and he's planning to do something terrible.

question: A real change of pace for him.
answer: Half this town will be there Stanley. I tried to tell the cops, but they wouldn't listen to me.

question: As long as he's got the mask, there's nothing they can do to stop him anyway. There's nothing anyone can do.
answer: There must be some way. How does it work? And if you've got a black heart?

question: Then the world's going to be a very dark place. And if I were you, I'd get out of town. Fast.
answer: Thanks.

question: For what?
answer: Lots of things. For really believing in me when I couldn't. For sharing a sunset with me. For being the first guy to treat me like I was a person instead of a slab of meat. And for being any kind of romantic. Even a hopeless one. You know, that night at the club I knew I met someone special. Someone like nobody I'd ever met before.

question: The Mask.
answer: No... the guy that was inside the Mask all the time. You. Stanley Ip - --kiss. I've got to disappear for awhile Stanley. I'm not sure where I'll go but I'll let you know as soon as I can.

question: Hey! A girl's being kidnapped out there! Do something!
answer: I just went out for a little while Dorian.

question: puts one hand over his eyes and slams the butt of the gun down as hard as he can on the Guard's head. THONK. The Guard drops back Come on.
answer: Ipkiss!

question: Hold it! I warn you! I'm seriously stressed out here!
answer: Easy, Ipkiss. Don't be an idiot. You're in the middle of a police station. There's no way you're just going to walk out of here. Now what are you doing?

question: Putting myself in your custody.
answer: You are certifiable.

question: Milo! Okay. Now we have to hurry or we'll miss the party.
answer: Of course. We wouldn't want to keep Alice and the white rabbit waiting.

question: Alright, suit yourself. You stay and be a good boy.
answer: The Swede scrambles under a crap table to escape the mayhem and bumps into Mayor Tilton. The Thug seems to be enjoying the mayhem when he hears an off camera WHISTLE. He pulls out his .45 and cautiously enters the kitchen to investigate.

question: plucks the gun from the unconscious Guard and sneaks into the casino.
answer: Stanley appears out of the kitchen doors and gets the attention of the nearest captive party-goers.

question: I'll take that.
answer: Hold it right there or you'll be looking for this on the bottom of the harbor.

question: Drop it and I'll kill you all.
answer: You can have it. But she gets to go.
